phrase.item: (Cow and bull) manure.
Sometimes they make the manure flat, when the cow makes manure, they make it into a ball and put it on the wall or on top of a stone.
When it gets dry, they burn it.
They make another kind, too.
In the stable, they make it like dough. They put it on the wall.
When it gets dry, they will burn it (use it for fire).
Also when it gets wet under the animals (the ground) in the fold, in order to make it try they but fround dry animal manure.
Ikang is like dry dirt.
That (the dry manure) gets mixed with the (cow's fresh) manure.
Then they take it to the field, it is called ðart (mixed manure).
Sheep/goat manure.
Sheep/goat manure has two types.
First is the grounded (cow or bull) manure, that is used for putting babies to sleep.
First they beat the cow manure. They they take it out of the parwizan.
Then they put the ground part in a fabric or blanket, which is called ðɨn.
Then they put the baby to sleep there.
Till ____ they wrap the (baby) with the fabric containing manure because the manure is warm.
If a baby pees on the manure, it will get round.
Whenever the mother takes her (the baby), she picks the small rounds and makes it clean.
In the winter time they warm stones and put them insde the manure.
That will get warmer.
It is because there is not enough cotton, so a child is raised by using the manure.
The baby will be wrapped with the fabric until he/she is one year old .
There is also goat and cattle manure.
They dry it and burn it (for making fire).
They ground that type of manure and mix it with water and make a bowl out of it, so that whoever doesn't have dishes they can use it to put tabacco, flour or wheat.
